title: (x) McDonald's logo and tagline - Akzidenz Grotesk, Helvetica (modified) {Marc O}
content:
Looking for the typeface in the “I’m lovin’ it” in the first image and then the simple type of “McDonald’s” in the second image

Is the “I’m Lovin’ It” in Azidenz (sp?) Grotesque?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [mcd im lovin it.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042718/http:/typophile.com/files/mcd%20im%20lovin%20it.jpg) | 68.61 KB |
| [mcdonalds arch.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042718/http:/typophile.com/files/mcdonalds%20arch.jpg) | 5.7 KB |

 [‹ (x) Pixel script - Unibody {Pieter}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042718/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32280 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) New York Paris London Fairhaven serif face - Footlight {Rob Sutton} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905042718/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32274 "Go to next forum topic")
author: blueanxiety

comments.content:
Yes, “I’m Lovin It” is Akzidenz Grotesk.

I’ve read (but can’t confirm) that the McDonald’s logotype is a weight of Helvetica with an upside-down W for the M.
